forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South southeast wind 7 to 12 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Monday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a high near 56. Southeast wind 7 to 10 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, the promise of rain lingers in the air, cloaking the city in a gentle, mottled grey. The clouds hang low, creating an enveloping softness that dims the twinkling city lights just beginning to awaken. Currently, the landscape is draped in a veiled shroud, with visibility reduced by a thickening marine layer, an all-too-familiar companion along the coast. Tonight’s forecast brings a high likelihood of rain, as if the heavens above have decided to spill their contents in an understated, yet persistent manner. With temperatures hovering around a cool 51°F, the evening unfolds as a reminder of the city’s character: moody yet beautifully complex, where one might find comfort in the depths of a cozy café or the warmth of a knit scarf.

Looking ahead to Monday, expect a continuation of this drizzly embrace, with a high near 56°F and persistent clouds that might leave you feeling a touch dreary if unprepared. As the winds whisper from the southeast, consider layering up with water-resistant attire, perhaps a stylish trench coat, to navigate the evening’s damp embrace. A stroll through the quieted streets, perhaps pausing to savor a warm beverage in the glow of local cafés, seems fitting for such a night. The rain invites introspection—the perfect time for an invigorating read or a contemplative moment in the solitude of your home, watching the world shimmer and dance in the downpour.
